title: Condiments Quiz
description: Ketchup, mustard, and beyond — how well do you know the world's favorite condiments?

questions.question: Ketchup was originally made from which ingredient before tomatoes became the standard?
Dijon mustard gets its name from a city in which country?
Which condiment is made by emulsifying oil, egg yolks, and vinegar or lemon juice?
Soy sauce is a fermented condiment made from soybeans and which grain?
Fish sauce, a pungent liquid condiment, is essential in the cuisines of which region?
Worcestershire sauce was created in which English city?
Tahini, a paste used in hummus and other dishes, is made from which seed?
Which Italian condiment, made from balsamic vinegar reduced to a thick, sweet glaze, is often drizzled on salads?
Chutney is a condiment that originates from which cuisine?
HP Sauce, a popular brown sauce in Britain, has a picture of which building on its label?
Chimichurri, a fresh herb sauce, is traditionally served with grilled meats in which country?
Which Japanese condiment is a citrus-based sauce often used as a dipping sauce for dumplings?
Relish is a chunky condiment most commonly associated with which pickled vegetable in the United States?
Hoisin sauce, sometimes called 'Chinese barbecue sauce,' is made from which bean?
Which French condiment combines cornichons, capers, mustard, and herbs, and is served with meats and charcuterie?
